section.label: Define Interaction and Select Usage URI: Step 1

helpgrid.innerhtml: Specify whether the interaction is for creating a resource in a provider, for associating data with a resource in a provider, or for querying a resource from a provider. Then, specify a resource type. Usage URIs for the resource type are retrieved from the provider application so that you can select a URL for the interaction.

section.label: Select Service Provider for OSLC Interaction {0}: Step 2

helpgrid.innerhtml: You can specify that all service providers in the provider application are available for the interaction or you can specify a URI for a single service provider for the interaction.
To generate a link from the provider application to your application data, specify an association property.
You can specify a path to a link and the link description for a provider. In the consumer application, the users can click the link to preview resource data from a provider.

section.label: Select Application for OSLC Interaction {0}: Step 3

helpgrid.innerhtml: To automatically update the user interface, specify the application tab and the button label.

table.label: Application Security Groups Authorized to Launch Interaction

section.label: Specify Interaction Mappings for OSLC Interaction {0}: Step 4

helpgrid.innerhtml: For an interaction that creates data in the OSLC provider application, you can provide default values. Map the fields in the application to target fields in the provider application window that opens when the user starts the interaction.

section.label: Specify Queries and Query Parameters for OSLC Interaction {0}: Step 4

helpgrid.innerhtml: You can enter a Where clause, provide a custom class that constructs the Where clause, or you can map fields from the consumer application to target fields in the provider application.

section.label: Add Interaction {0} to an Interaction Group: Step 5

helpgrid.innerhtml: If you want to add the interaction to a interaction group, specify a group name and optionally, specify a condition. If the interaction group does not exist, it is automatically generated. Groups can be managed in the Add/Modify Interaction Groups dialog box. If you specify an interaction group, the interaction is run only as part of the group and is not run independently.
You can specify an interaction group and identify one or more interactions that can be run as part of the group.

You can specify interactions to include in the group and the conditions when the interactions are run. Only interactions that have the same object name as the interaction group are available for selection.

You must specify the application to which the interaction group is added. If the main object of the application is not the same as the interaction group object, you must specify a relationship to retrieve the data. You can enable support for the interaction group as a button on the application or as a field-level Detail Menu item. If you want to create a Detail Menu item, specify a menu label, and on the Application Menu tab, specify the additional details.

table.label: Applications Associated with an Interaction Group {0}
table.parentemptylabel: Applications Associated with an Interaction Group

table.label: Application Security Groups Authorized to Launch the Interaction Group
Application Security Groups Authorized to Launch Interaction Group

helpgrid.innerhtml: You can associate the interaction group with an existing field-level Detail Menu item in the consumer application.
